entry.title: The Dark Knight Before Christmas - A Superbat Year One AU
entry.summary:
Author: EllEmmeCe

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,408Chapters: 23/25Kudos: 33

Summary: Gotham is having a very strange Christmas. Bruce Wayne’s latest vigilante experiment, a horned shadowy figure the press has named “Krampus,” was supposed to terrify criminals. Instead, it has gone viral as Gotham’s new holiday mascot. Clark Kent, investigative reporter and part-time baker, is on the case. He is following Krampus’s trail of cookie crumbs (literally) while secretly moonlighting as “Super Santa” to fix Gotham’s holiday chaos. Between gingerbread turtle clues, a viral photo of Krampus tangled in Christmas lights, and Alfred’s endless commentary, Bruce is one bad cape snag away from losing his mind. Meanwhile, Clark is just trying to figure out if Gotham’s scariest new legend is a monster, a myth, or a very grumpy man who needs a hug. It is a holiday season full of crime, cookies, and questionable branding decisions.

entry.title: Sundays, Fridays, and Other Things We Didn’t Name
entry.summary:
Author: NightTwink73

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,875Chapters: 9/12Kudos: 63

Summary: Bruce Wayne’s life begins to reorganize itself around small, unintentional rituals: dinners on Sundays, movies on Fridays, a child who climbs where he shouldn’t and smiles like sunlight.Clark Kent fits into those spaces so easily it’s almost dangerous. Misunderstandings bloom. Feelings go unnamed.And somewhere between quiet nights, shared meals, and things no one quite knows how to say, a family starts to take shape.

entry.title: Why'd you have to chase the light, somewhere I can't go?
entry.summary:
Author: Speechless_since_1998

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,280Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 121

Summary: "Why are you here, Nightwing?" Superman's voice was calm but firm as he spoke. He didn't even turn around, all his attention on the man lying on the bed, gripping his hand. He touched him as if he were the most precious thing in the world. Dick didn't want to look: Bruce shouldn't be like this, immobile, surrounded by machinery. "I'm here for him," Dick said, standing in front of the bed, still looking at Superman, because he couldn't see his father Bruce in that way. Superman made a contemptuous noise, completely out of place for him, "And obviously, you're alone. Where are the others? Minding their own business?" Dick curled his lip, defensive. "Someone had to stay in Gotham, you know." "If my father had been saved from a cult that wanted to sacrifice him to an alien god, I'd be right there with him," the alien said angrily. "But apparently, he doesn't even deserve that grace, does he?"   (Batman was a legend. Batman was invincible. But Bruce Wayne was just a man, and Dick wasn't ready to face the chance of seeing another parent die, without being able to tell him he didn't hate him.)

entry.title: When Darkness Meets the Light
entry.summary:
Author: YairPL

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,613Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 24

Summary: One year after donning the cowl, Bruce Wayne is no hero. Batman is a specter of vengeance and fury, an unstable project channeling the trauma of a child still screaming in an alleyway. His mission is a self-destructive obsession, and Gotham, a black hole deserving to be purged with fire. Clark Kent, on the other hand, bears the weight of a power he believes he owes to the universe. His invincibility is not a gift, but a shield that must stand before all the pain of others, a cosmic guilt that drives him to save even those who do not want to be saved. When the Daily Planet reporter is assigned to cover Bruce Wayne's charity gala, a clash of ideologies tears away both their masks. Clark sees the deep open wound behind the playboy. Bruce feels for the first time truly seen. This is the story of how light does not always blind the darkness; sometimes, it sits beside it in silence and offers to heal its wounds. It is the journey of two men meeting at the precipice: one learning to be a hero, and the other learning to be human. And from the fragile bridge of understanding they build, the legend will be born.

entry.title: Punk Rocker, Gotham Horror
entry.summary:
Author: brunetta6

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 103,647Chapters: 17/18Kudos: 1,027

Summary: One month after the dimensional rift tore through Metropolis, a reclusive benefactor organizes a charity gala to help with the city’s recovery efforts. Clark Kent – who is, fortunately or unfortunately, freshly single – finds himself personally requested to spend a week in Gotham doing a fluff piece on its very own dark prince. Perry also gives him an… “optional” side mission. Get an interview with the local, cryptid vigilante known as The Batman. Everything that happens after? Only some of it will appear in the history books.
